detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This course is restricted to students in Year 3 of programs other than the Bachelor of Commerce. It will be offered in a flexible learning format. Rather than attending traditional in-class lectures for three hours each week, students in a flexible format section will spend more time with online learning materials in preparation for fewer scheduled in-person meeting times. Instructors will provide exact dates for in-person meeting times closer to the start of term.

If you have been admitted by your Faculty to the Minor in Commerce or you are in another approved program for which this course is a requirement, and you are unable to register in any section of this course in your final year of study, you may submit a registration request using the form available at mybcom.sauder.ubc.ca/regi-assist. Commerce course registration is managed centrally by the UBC Sauder Undergraduate Office. Change of Registration (Add/Drop) forms signed by instructors will not be accepted.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
The Literature of Forests, Environment & Place
iv.
Open up your chest:
will I find words buried
behind your ribs
Iike a midden,
like a riverbank?
Will I find words like stones,
like gleaming shells
in heavy earth?
(“Anatomy,” Jess Housty)

The truth about stories is that that’s all we are.
(The Truth About Stories, Thomas King)

To live in a storied world is to know that… each land, each valley, each wild community of plants and
animals and soils has it particular style of intelligence… Each ecology has its own psyche and the
local people buy into their imaginations, to the psyche of their place, by letting the land dream its tales
through them. (The Spell of the Sensuous, David Abram)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
If Workday indicates that you do not meet the CPSC 417 prerequisites, but you have taken CPSC 313, CPSC 317, and one of the courses credit-excluded with STAT 200 or STAT 241/251 in the UBC Science Credit Exclusion List, then you may submit a Request for Registration Assistance Form as described at:
https://www.cs.ubc.ca/students/undergrad/courses-deadlines/cpsc-appeals-steps-undergraduate-students.

Please ensure that you include in your message exactly what course that you have taken is credit-excluded with STAT 200 or STAT 241/251 and which section of CPSC 417 you are interested in. Requests that do not follow these guidelines may be denied without consideration.

If your request is approved, we will either grant you permission to register yourself (if your registration date has not yet arrived), register you for a lecture and tutorial section (if it has and a seat is available), or otherwise: waitlist you with an effective waitlist date no later than the next business day after the date your request for registration assistance included complete information.

instances.text: CPSC_V 420-201 - Advanced Algorithms Design and Analysis

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
If Workday indicates you do not meet the CPSC 425 prerequisites, but you have taken CPSC 221 one of [MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, and MATH 253] and one of [MATH 152, MATH 221, and MATH 223], then you may submit a Request for Registration Assistance Form as described at:
https://www.cs.ubc.ca/students/undergrad/courses-deadlines/cpsc-appeals-steps-undergraduate-students.

Please ensure that you include in your message exactly what courses that you have taken meet the MATH requirements and which section(s) of CPSC 425 you are interested in, in priority order. Requests that do not follow these guidelines may be denied without consideration.

If your request is approved, we will either grant you permission to register yourself (if your registration date has not yet arrived), register you for a lecture section (if it has and a seat is available), or otherwise: waitlist you with an effective waitlist date no later than the next business day after the date your request for registration assistance included complete information.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
If Workday indicates you do not meet the CPSC 425 prerequisites, but you have taken CPSC 221 one of [MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, and MATH 253] and one of [MATH 152, MATH 221, and MATH 223], then you may submit a Request for Registration Assistance Form as described at:
https://www.cs.ubc.ca/students/undergrad/courses-deadlines/cpsc-appeals-steps-undergraduate-students.

Please ensure that you include in your message exactly what courses that you have taken meet the MATH requirements and which section(s) of CPSC 425 you are interested in, in priority order. Requests that do not follow these guidelines may be denied without consideration.

If your request is approved, we will either grant you permission to register yourself (if your registration date has not yet arrived), register you for a lecture section (if it has and a seat is available), or otherwise: waitlist you with an effective waitlist date no later than the next business day after the date your request for registration assistance included complete information.

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
